intro: Pinanga watanaiana, commonly known as the Bornean arrowleaf, is a species of plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves, which are usually dark green and have a smooth texture. It typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, where it thrives in the moist, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
